revised_title: Salt Relations in Woody Tissues: Experiments with Wood Disks
tldr: This study investigates the movement of ions and solutes in wood, focusing on the exchange between the walls of dead xylem elements and living cells. The researchers used yew wood and willow disks to analyze the ionic exchange and the effect of living and dead cells on the composition of the transpiration stream. The findings provide insights into the rate of base exchange and the amount of an ion bound by the exchange system in woody tissues.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Plant Science
